alert.note: Alert for Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 9:58PM PST until January 10 at 12:15AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Guadalupe River above Alamaden Expressway affecting Santa Clara County. For the Guadalupe River...including Alamaden Expressway...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River above Alamaden Expressway. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. River begins to overtop upstream of Alma Avenue Bridge into the Elks Lodge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM PST Sunday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 10.0 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 8.7 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will rise above flood stage again tomorrow afternoon to 9.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage again tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 03/10/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1000 AM PST.
